channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15365] Do not write to '/tmp' in TestHBaseConfiguration
item.description: In testGetPassword, we create a key file at /tmp/foo.jks and set its permissions to 600. This will cause testcase failure on a shared machine.
item.summary: Do not write to '/tmp' in TestHBaseConfiguration

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
A trivial fix.
Just write to a tmp directory and delete the directoty after test.

+1 overall

Where does the below get created?

private static File TEST_DIR = new File(TestHBaseConfiguration.class.getSimpleName());

In current dir?

Could you use HBaseTestUtility? It has support for tmp dir creation and removal at end of test?

If not, thats fine.

+1
